children.text: Pietra Index is defined as twice the maximal area of a triangle that can be fitted between the ROC curve of the model and the diagonal of the unit square. The multiplication by 2 ensures that the range of possible values for the index is [0,1]. The closer the Pietra index is to unity, the better the rating model.

Pietra index is calculated under the assumption that the area under the ROC is convex. In this case the Pietra Index matches the Kolmogorov-Smirnov statistic indicated by the vertical dotted line in the plot.
